alert.note: Alert for Southern Inner Channels (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 10 at 4:02PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following area, Southern Inner Channels. This includes the cities of Ketchikan And Metlakatla. * WHEN...Through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rain continues across the area with 2.5 to 4 inches falling in the last 24 hours. The rain has already caused the snow depth to decrease from 25 inches down to 11 inches as of 3pm Monday north of Ketchikan and area creeks are steadily rising. Additional rainfall of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected through Tuesday afternoon. With continued snowmelt and increased runoff, ponding of water and localized flooding remain possible.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
